intro: Geophila trichogyne, commonly known as the hairy leaf geophila, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, giving it its common name. Geophila trichogyne produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a subtle ornamental value to its habitat.
